name: SignEdit
description: This event is fired when a sign is being edited.
overview: Fires when a player edits a sign. The `pos` field contains the sign's world position. The `signText` field contains the current sign text lines. This event is cancellable, preventing the sign edit. Useful for sign filtering, validation, and automation.

constructors.description: Represents the data associated with a sign edit event. This object is passed to 'SignEdit' event listeners, providing access to sign properties and allowing modification or cancellation.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: The world position of the sign being edited. This contains the X, Y, and Z coordinates of the sign block in the world.

parameters.name: closeScreen
parameters.description: Whether to close the sign editing screen. This can be modified to control whether the sign editing interface should be closed after processing.

parameters.name: front
parameters.description: Whether editing the front or back of the sign. `true` - Editing the front side of the sign, `false` - Editing the back side of the sign.

parameters.name: signText
parameters.description: The current text lines on the sign. This contains up to 4 lines of sign text. Lines may be empty or null. This can be modified to change the sign content.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the event object.
